properties.name: Cork, Ireland
properties.description: Posted by Baaghcork, irelandOur 3rd stop through Ireland in the 1st week - we came here through Kilkenny on our way to Kilarney. Probably my favourite town. We stayed for about 2 days and shopped, drank, ate, and relaxed. Did some great walks through the city and visited the old gael

properties.name: Cusco, Peru
properties.description: Posted by Baaghcusco, peruThis is where we should have spent the rest of our vacation off of the Inca Trail. A wonderful city, friendly, warm, inexpensive, and pretty much safe. There isn\'t enough good things to say about Cusco. We travelled here to meet up with our tour group for the Inca Trail (SAS - http://www.sastravelperu.com/). We found SAS to be a great group - from our first email of inquiry from the States to the final day at Machu Picchu, we found them to be very professional, a great group of local guides, and great personalities.

properties.name: Dingle, Ireland
properties.description: Posted by Baaghdingle irelandMy 1st stop, 2nd week in Ireland. After dropping Jeni off at Dublin airport, I took the train to Tralee followed by a bus ride into Dingle. What a beautiful place. I spent the 2nd week hiking around the peninsula and met some nice travellers from Europe and the States here

properties.name: Dublin, Ireland
properties.description: Posted by MdeghettoDublin, Ireland

properties.name: Dublin, Ireland
properties.description: Posted by Baaghdublin, irelandOur first stop in a beautiful city. This was my first visit to an international city and it took about 24 hours to feel \'there\'. After an all-night flight from Toronto, we arrived in the morning without a place to stay, hungry, and tired. Pushing through, though, we found a McD\'s for a quick bite to eat and then found a place to sleep that night. Met a nice couple from Germany and went out for drinks with them at a bar downtown. Funny thing was, all the music being played at the bar was NA music - John Denver and Take Me Home!

properties.name: E Sciences, Fort Lauderdale
properties.description: Posted by Baagh5310 nw 33rd avenue, fort lauderdale, floridaMy first professional job as an environmental specialist (Staff Scientist). Worked for 2 1/2 years with Nadia and Pattie.

properties.name: Golder Associates
properties.description: Posted by Baagh309 Exeter Road, london ontarioMy second professional position as an environmental specialist. Hired on in early August 2005.

properties.name: Historic Sanctuary of Machu Picchu
properties.description: Posted by Baagh    Machu Picchu stands 2,430 m above sea-level, in the middle of a tropical mountain forest, in an extraordinarily beautiful setting. It was probably the most amazing urban creation of the Inca Empire at its height; its giant walls, terraces and ramps seem as if they have been cut naturally in the continuous rock escarpments. The natural setting, on the eastern slopes of the Andes, encompasses the upper Amazon basin with its rich diversity of flora and fauna.

properties.name: Home
properties.description: Posted by Baagh12 evergreen avenue, london ontario canadaOur 1st house, purchased in October 2005

properties.name: Kilkenny, Ireland
properties.description: Posted by Baaghkilkenny, irelandOur 2nd stop during the 1st week. Jeni and I took a bus from Dublin here after spending a couple days in Dublin. Without knowing, we arrived the same day of a huge outdoor concert - no places were available to spend the night. or so we were told. After visiting the castle in town (Kilkenny castle?) we called a hostel just outside of town - they had space, and offerred to pick us up too! And cool - the hostel was located in an old norman tower. It wasn\'t the cleanest hostel we\'d been in, but man was it ever a neat place.

properties.name: Killarney, Ireland
properties.description: Posted by Baaghkillarney, irelandThis was our last stop during the 1st week. We spent the most time here relaxing. Stayed in a b&b for the first night - well worth it! mostly shopped and walked around. We met a couple travelling from Israel who offered to drive us around a bit, so we visited a waterfall and ross castle with them. Ate some good food here - got our first fish and chips and \'Den Joes\' :) loved it.

properties.name: Mira Flores, Peru
properties.description: Posted by BaaghMira Flores, peruAh - our 2nd anniversary trip to Peru. Jeni and I landed in Peru for a nine day much-needed vacation. Lima was our gateway and final destination while in Peru. We had some great experiences here - most of the people we met were very friendly. Ate at some great local restaurants, and found some great shopping.

properties.name: Our 1st apartment together
properties.description: Posted by Baagh2751 Ocean Club blvd, hollywood florida2nd floor apartment overlooking mangroves. Walk to the beach, close to friends. We lived here between 2003 and 2005

properties.name: Our wedding reception
properties.description: Posted by BaaghBlack Bear ResortAwesome place - 2 decks, the full lodge, and views of the blue mountains. good time!

properties.name: Tralee, Ireland
properties.description: Posted by BaaghTralee, IrelandThis was my first town, and my last town to visit in Ireland. After I had dropped Jeni off in Dublin for her flight back home, I took the train here. This was my gateway to Dingle so I spent just a few hours here at first. After Dingle, however, I spent two days relaxing - visited a church, saw my first Gaelic Football match, and did some shopping.

properties.name: We were married here!
properties.description: Posted by Baaghwest virginiaThomas West Virginia
